description: Students working as tutors and teacher aides gain direct teaching experience in urban
schools. This course is designed to heighten students' sensitivities to the complexities of
the education of urban youth in a multicultural setting. Prerequisite: Education 290, 2.7 GPA,
meeting all off-campus study requirements and satisfactory portfolio progress. The course
fulfills Education 382 and partially fulfills clinical practicum requirements. Counts toward
the major: American Racial and Multicultural Studies.
fullname: Urban Education Seminar & Practicum (off-campus: Minn/St. P)
